New Records: Fakhar Zaman scored the fastest century (81 balls) in a World Cup match for Pakistan.
New Zealand recorded their highest score of 401 in a World Cup game.
Pakistan successfully chased down a target using the Duckworth-Lewis method, their first win in a high-scoring World Cup match.
Key Match Events: Rain interrupted play multiple times, leading to the use of the Duckworth-Lewis method to determine the outcome.
Fakhar Zaman's unbeaten 126 off 81 balls was the key performance for Pakistan.
New Zealand's highest partnership was 180 between Kane Williamson and Rachin Ravindra.
Pakistan's victory kept their hopes alive in the World Cup tournament.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan won the toss and chose to bat first.
New Zealand's bowling attack was initially expensive, with Trent Boult conceding runs quickly.
Both teams were aware of the need for aggressive scoring due to the high target.
Post-Match Reflections: Fakhar Zaman described his century as one of his best and expressed confidence for future matches.
Kane Williamson praised Pakistan's performance and acknowledged the challenging conditions.
The win was significant for Pakistan's morale ahead of the next matches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was affected by rain, leading to frequent inspections and interruptions.
The high-scoring nature of the game set a new record for New Zealand in the World Cup.
Pakistan's victory kept their semifinal hopes alive, impacting other teams' standings.
Others: The game was part of the 2023 Cricket World Cup, with implications for teams like England and Australia.
